content: Tabs organize content into multiple sections. They are composed of `Tabs` and `Tab` components and support both static and dynamic collections of items.

Tabs support different `variants` (solid, bordered, light, underlined), `colors`, `sizes`, and `radius`. The tab list can be positioned on the `top`, `bottom`, `start`, or `end` with the `placement` prop or made `isVertical`.
You can add icons to `Tab` components by using the `title` prop and passing a component that includes an icon.
Tabs can be a controlled component. Use the `selectedKey` prop to set the active tab and the `onSelectionChange` event to handle changes.
Tab components can be rendered as links by passing an `href` prop, making them compatible with client-side routers. See the Routing guide for setup.
Key stylable slots are `base`, `tabList`, `tab`, `tabContent`, `cursor` (for the animation), and `panel`.
